case_vignette: A 22-YEAR-OLD MALE PRESENTS WITH A FOLLICULAR ERUPTION THAT HAS BEEN PRESENT FOR 2 WEEKS. HE HAS A HISTORY OF ANOREXIA NERVOSA AND ALCOHOLISM. THERE IS NO IDENTIFIABLE PRECEDING INCIDENT RELATED TO THE ERUPTION. HE DENIES A HISTORY OF ATOPY, DRUG USE, AND NEW MEDICATIONS. A REVIEW OF SYSTEMS SHOWS POSITIVE FINDINGS FOR JOINT PAIN AND BLEEDING GUMS. PHYSICAL EXAM REVEALS ECCHYMOSIS AND PURPURIC FOLLICULAR PAPULES WITH CORKSCREW-LIKE HAIR ON HIS LEGS AND ARMS.

I don't have a family history of autoimmune diseases or skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Scurvy
